Key Match Events: Emilio Pagán gave up Seth Brown's three-run home run in the top of the eighth inning
Will Benson slugged a three-run homer to right field in the bottom of the seventh inning
Post-Match Reflections: Cincinnati instead was handed a 9-6 loss by the A's on Wednesday at Great American Ball Park
We lost it together. It’s nobody’s fault
Pagán, he’s the beast. He has given us a lot and has done a lot in this league. We just came up short, that’s it.
It all matters, especially when it’s a hit or homer that helps your team come back and take a lead
Hopefully as an organization, we can build on it moving forward
There’s a nucleus of guys here that’s going to be here hopefully for a long time and have really successful careers
Miscellaneous Highlights: Benson's first homer since July 29 and his 13th of the season
Batting.193 with a.664 OPS this season, Benson entered the at-bat 4-for-27 (.148) with one RBI for all of August
Before his drive landed in the seats, a fired-up Benson had already flipped his bat and started yelling toward the Reds dugout
Cruz, who opened the game with Lawrence Butler hitting a homer before pitching three innings with six strikeouts -- both career highs
